Description: Rattaché au Responsable de la MarTech, le Data Scientist est en charge de concevoir, développer et améliorer des modèles analytiques pour créer de la valeur ajoutée pour les métiers et aider la banque dans ses prises de décision. A ce titre, il prend en charge les activités suivantes :Extraction et structuration des donnéesÉlaboration des algorithmes d’intelligence artificielleIndustrialisation des modèles d’intelligence artificielle dans les applicationsParticipation active aux projetsVeille technologique sur les outils de data science Les missions :  Extraction et structuration des donnéesExtraire les données nécessaires à l’analyse (Web scraping, API…).Définir des règles de gestion de nettoyage des bases de données (formatage, suppression des doublons…).Définir des règles de gestion de structuration des différentes bases de données entre elles.Écrire et rédiger les spécifications d’automatisation des règles de gestion à la DSI ou à la maîtrise d’ouvrage.Maîtriser la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement.Déterminer ou construire les variables importantes à introduire dans les modèles statistiques.Élaboration des algorithmes d’intelligence artificielleAnalyser les données en utilisant des méthodes statistiques classiques.Créer et tester des algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique (machine learning, deep learning…).Construire les données d’entraînement des modèles.Réaliser une amélioration continue des modèles.Industrialisation des modèles d’intelligence artificielle dans les applicationsIndustrialiser les modèles d’apprentissage automatique et des modèles statistiques.Prendre part aux vérifications lors des mises en production (recette).Définir les règles de gestion pour la maintenance des modèles (monitoring).Participation active aux projetsParticiper aux ateliers d’expression des besoins internes.Comprendre précisément les problématiques métiers et les traduire de manière analytique.Communiquer les résultats et les solutions avec les équipes métiers.Veille technologique sur les outils de data scienceEffectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles de data science.Rechercher et expérimenter de nouvelles méthodes de modélisation et de data science. Profil :  Formation : Bac +5 en ingénierie, mathématiques, statistiques, informatique ou équivalent.Expérience : Minimum 3 - 5 ans d’expérience en data science avec une solide connaissance des outils de machine learning et d'analyse de données.Compétences techniques : Maîtrise des langages de programmation (Python, R), des frameworks de machine learning (TensorFlow, scikit-learn) et des bases de données (SQL).Compétences en communication : Capacité à expliquer des concepts techniques à un public non-technique et à travailler en équipe.

Référence 240001ZX   Vos missions au quotidien   Prendre en charge la conception, le développement et l'amélioration de modèles analytiques permettant de créer de la valeur ajoutée pour les métiers et d'aider la banque dans ses prises de décision Développer des use cases de bout en bout, en collaboration avec la Digital Factory ainsi que les lignes métiers Concevoir et développer les modèles de machine learning et de data mining nécessaires à la livraison de la solution définie par l’équipe projet Faire évoluer les modélisations et améliorer l'efficacité des modèles conçus tenant compte des retours des métiers ainsi que des résultats terrains obtenus Récupérer et analyser les données pertinentes liées au processus de production de l’entreprise, à la vente ou encore liées aux données client et ce afin d'apporter une information décisionnelle Construire des algorithmes permettant d’améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblage Élaborer des modèles prédictifs afin d’anticiper l’évolution des données et tendances relatives à l’activité de l’entreprise Modéliser les résultats d'analyse des données et les présenter avec des recommandations et des plans d'actions exploitables par les managers métier   Et si c’était vous ?   Bac+5Diplôme d'ingénieur ou Diplôme en mathématiques, statistiques, économétrie5 ans minimumExpérience dans le développement et l’application de modèles prédictifs   Pourquoi nous choisir ?   SG Maroc   Diversité et inclusion   Nous sommes un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à promouvoir tous les talents, quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, origine ethnique, nationalité, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

Job Title: AB & Multivariate Testing Tool Consultant (Optimizely or VWO)
Description: Job Description  Position Overview:  We are looking for a Multivariate Optimization Consultant to share their expertise in installing and configuring multivariate optimization software such as Optimizely or VWO. This short-term engagement will primarily focus on a Q&A and knowledge-sharing session, where the consultant will provide insights and best practices for setting up custom instrumentation for experimentation.  Key Responsibilities:   Conduct a Q&A session to discuss best practices for installing and configuring multivariate optimization software. Share experiences and insights on custom instrumentation techniques for linking UX variants with experimentation tools. Provide guidance on troubleshooting common issues encountered during the setup process. Offer recommendations for optimizing the use of Optimizely, VWO, or similar tools in future projects. Prepare any necessary documentation or resources to support the learning session.  Qualifications:   Direct experience with installing and configuring Optimizely, VWO, or similar multivariate optimization software. Strong understanding of custom instrumentation and UX variant definitions. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts in an accessible manner. Experience in a consulting or training role is a plus.

Attijariwafa bank est le premier groupe bancaire et financier du Maghreb et un acteur financier de référence en Afrique. En plus de l’activité bancaire, le Groupe opère, à travers des filiales spécialisées, dans tous les métiers financiers : assurance, crédit immobilier, crédit à la consommation, leasing, gestion d’actifs, intermédiation boursière, conseil, location longue durée, factoring… Attijariwafa bank est basée au Maroc et opère dans 25 pays. Avec 20 602 collaborateurs, le groupe Attijariwafa bank compte 10,2 millions de clients. Il dispose du réseau de distribution le plus large au Maroc et le plus dense en Afrique avec 5 265 agences.

AudaCity Capital is a progressive and flourishing prop trading firm, and trading education provider. We are based in London, and at the moment have a team of highly trained properly trading professionals, managing the company’s extensive funds on our City of London based trading floor.We believe that the only way to be a winner in our industry is to invest heavily in talented people who want to grow with us. We are seeking like-minded professionals to develop their skills and enable them to join our team.We trade on all major asset classes on multiple exchanges with our own capital and do not handle any client funds or have customers. By becoming a member of the team, you become part of our success. Ideal Profile  You possess a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or related field.You have at least 3 years experience, ideally within a Data Analyst or Data Engineer role.Demonstrated experience working with large and complex data sets as well as experience analyzing volumes of data.You have good presentation and communication skills and the ability to present you findings clearly and accessibly in the form of reports and presentations to senior colleagues.You have working knowledge of Artificial intelligenceYou are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environmentsYou possess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical dataYou enjoy finding creative solutions to problems  What's on Offer?  Work within a company with a solid track record of successLeadership RoleFlexible working options

We are looking for Data Scientists for our client, a leading multinational IT services company.As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in solving diverse business challenges using advanced data analytics and machine learning techniques. You will work collaboratively to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring business impact across various industries and domains. Responsibilities:Data Exploration and Analysis:Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and insights.Clean, preprocess, and transform structured and unstructured data from various sources.Model Development:Build and implement machine learning models for predictive, prescriptive, and descriptive analytics.Optimize models for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.Adapt models and approaches to meet the needs of different industries and projects.Collaboration with Stakeholders:Work closely with business teams to understand problems and define data-driven solutions.Collaborate with Data Engineers, Analysts, and IT teams to ensure seamless data pipelines and deployment.Data Visualization and Communication:Present complex findings and models in a clear, accessible way using visualizations and storytelling.Create dashboards and reports to track model performance and business impact. Requirements:Minimum 3 years working in machine learning and analytics, preferably in a multinational environment.Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.Proficient in Python, R, or Julia for machine learning development.Strong expertise in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.Hands-on experience with big data tools like Apache Spark.Familiarity with cloud ML platforms (SageMaker, Azure ML, Google AI Platform).Knowledge of advanced techniques, including natural language processing (NLP), deep learning, and computer vision.Strong statistical and analytical capabilities.Experience with model deployment and monitoring.Ability to communicate data insights effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders.Nice-to-Have:Experience with MLOps tools and workflows for model deployment and monitoring.Understanding of business processes and domain-specific challenges.

Job Description:We are excited to offer an internship opportunity for individuals passionate about the convergence of AI, Data Science, DevOps, and Cloud technologies. As an AI, Data Science, DevOps, and Cloud Intern, you will have the unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in these dynamic and interconnected fields, working on innovative projects and collaborating with experienced professionals. Benefits: This internship offers an exciting opportunity to gain practical experience in AI, Data Science, DevOps, and Cloud technologies, working on impactful projects and contributing to the development of innovative solutions. If you are enthusiastic about technology and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply and join our team. At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Missions  People:  The Key-User ensures the appropriate support to end-users concerning his perimeter.  The Key-User trains end-users, both for process appropriation and IS tool. The KU has been trained to train the trainer cessions.  He leads the knowledge of the solution with RBPO by managing the skill matrix dedicated to end-users.  He is in charge to apply RBPO training supports for the specificities of the site or product line.  Solution:  The Key-User tests new functionalities or other upgrades of the solution.  The Key-User proposes IS or IT upgrades coming from his expertise or other workshops (Kaizen).  Processes:  The Key-User is accountable for process solving issues (idocs)  The Key-User is capturing incidents & defects raised by end-users. He processing characterization of issues. Whenever possible, he contains them by workaround. He (she) expresses issues & transmit them to the appropriate support team (RBPO).  He (she) is co located with other KU in his (her) site for sharing best practices & upgrade proposal.  Data / Config:  The Key-User is the leader of coherence of data (Config, Extract,…) for his stream within his (her) site and perform surveys data consistency with KU from other stream, even if those data are coming from other processes (ownership).  The Key-User manages the accounts access in his (her) stream, according to internal control rules.  The Key-User drives appropriate corrective action whenever it occurs.  The KU puts in place and manages IS usage control, ensuring that end-users are well using the system.  The Key-User is in charge of the elaboration of quality system reference and documentation of his (her) metier on his (her) site.  The Key-User animate the indicators (effectiveness metrics & PKI) in his (her) perimeter. Fluent in English both written and spoken  Position based in Fez  Will report to the Site GSI Manager.  You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. At EFG (ESL FACEIT Group) we create worlds beyond gameplay, where players and fans become a community. We pride ourselves in having a corporate social responsibility which is that “IT’S NOT GG, UNTIL IT’S GG FOR ALL”.Our passion, craft, and DNA align to create and shape the world of esports, gaming tournaments, leagues, events, and holistic ecosystems through our millions of players, fans, and heroes, as well as through our people and culture. As a People Data Analyst, you’ll play an essential role in building data solutions that support workforce planning, talent strategy, and more. Working closely with the People, Culture & Sustainability (PC&S) team, you’ll ensure our people data drives meaningful, strategic decisions across EFG. This is your chance to create insights that impact any company greatest resource, it’s people. For this opening, we’re seeking a People Data Analyst who’s ready to combine a passion for analytics with a dedication to building data-driven solutions. As a key part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to develop dashboards, refine data pipelines, and work on projects that impact EFG’s approach to people and culture. This role is more than just data support—it’s about transforming HR data into insights that empower our team and fuel smarter decision-making across the organization.You’ll be joining at a pivotal time to support the build-out of a full People Analytics Data suite. This will be a unique opportunity to grow with us, shaping data solutions that advance our people strategy and help establish a data-first culture in HR. This role is critical to supporting the People Analytics Data Suite, focusing on descriptive and diagnostic analysis to drive EFG’s people strategy. With the People Analytics Manager as your leader, you’ll drive many “first-ever analytical solutions” that will enable our organization’s growth. ExpectationsBuild and Elevate Data-Driven Solutions Dashboard Development & Continuous Iteration: Design dashboards that transform raw data into dynamic visuals using Tableau. Your work will bring workforce trends, talent planning insights, and critical metrics to life, helping the PC&S team make strategic, informed decisions;Data Pipeline Innovation: Partner with EFG Data Organization to develop and enhance data pipelines, leveraging SQL and Python to create seamless, reliable integrations that keep our data connected and ready for real-time insights.Ad-Hoc Analytics: Step in on special projects, collaborating with the Business Technology team to bring data insights to varied initiatives across EFG. Whether analyzing workforce trends or supporting a new people initiative, your insights will be a key driver for data-backed progress;Responsive Data Support: Manage Jira data requests, bringing a problem-solving mindset and precision to each one, ensuring that EDO provides accurate and timely solutions for our tactical needs.Guide Junior Talent and Foster Best Practices Mentorship and Support: Share your knowledge with the HR Data Specialist, guiding them on more complex analytics tasks and promoting best practices that ensure quality and consistency across the team;Collaborative Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with the People Analytics Manager to support data-driven projects in workforce planning, talent management, and attrition analysis. Your insights will help set the course for data-informed decisions that align with EFG’s goals.Ensure Data Governance and Security Data Stewardship: Champion data accuracy, security, and availability. Ensure HR data is carefully managed, following best practices for data governance, protecting sensitive information, and maintaining its reliability;Responsible Data Management: Maintain a high standard of data integrity by regularly auditing and monitoring data sources. Proactively identify and resolve any gaps or inconsistencies, safeguarding our data’s credibility and accessibility. RequirementsCreate Impactful Visuals and Solutions Dashboard Development: Skilled in Tableau, you know how to build dashboards that transform data into stories, making trends clear and accessible for strategic decisions;Data Pipeline Expertise: Proficient in ELT processes and data integration, you’re experienced in SQL and Python, ensuring data flows seamlessly to support robust analytics.Deliver Insightful Analysis Analytical Rigor: With a focus on descriptive and diagnostic analytics, you’re skilled in workforce planning and talent metrics. You bring a thoughtful approach to analyzing and sharing insights that help guide the PC&S team.Advanced SQL & Python: Expert in SQL and Python, you can transform raw data into structured insights, setting the stage for impactful, data-driven decisions. If a query runs longer than 5 minutes, you can run a query execution engine to diagnose your issue.Collaborate and Communicate with Purpose Stakeholder Engagement: You understand that every data insight is part of a larger story. Your experience sharing workforce and talent insights with senior leaders ensures that your work is not just accurate but artfully creates a mental tapestry of insights for your stakeholdersClear Communication: You know how to turn data findings into clear, actionable insights that drive decisions, supporting data literacy across HR and beyond.People > Numbers: You understand that your role is critical in delivering data about people in your organization, you know that these people are more than just a number and use your high EQ to deliver insights with the appropriate level of empathy.Support and Strengthen Systems HR Systems Knowledge: Proficient in HR platforms like BambooHR or HiBob, you ensure data is available, reliable, and well-managed for reporting and analysis;Jira Proficiency: Skilled in managing Jira data requests, you bring responsiveness and accuracy to every task;Analytics Toolkit Proficient: Experience in leading tools such as; Snowflake, Tableau, and Github are a must, DBT nice-to-have. TRAITS When we say a “team player” we mean it - you have a crisp high-five and funny stories to tell. You have your team’s back, and the team has yours.You believe in a blameless culture, your version of problem-solving is finding the root cause, the best solution, and building it as a team.You’re curious about things you don’t know, aren’t afraid to ask questions, and seek truth through dataLike a brave first responder, you’re often running toward the challengeYou make the time to cheer and enjoy the ride.

Management Systems International (MSI), a Tetra Tech Company, is a Washington, D.C. metro area management consultancy with a 40-year history of delivering results for our clients. Our expertise is in the fields of monitoring and evaluation; democracy and governance; peace and stability; rule of law and accountability; education; gender and inclusion; strategic communications; and leadership and organizational development. MSI has implemented projects in 90 countries around the world such as Colombia, Indonesia, Jordan, Kenya, Mexico, Nigeria, Pakistan, Syria and Ukraine, and works domestically. We support clients ranging from the U.S. Government (e.g., the U.S. Agency for International Development, U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Departments of State and Labor, and the Millennium Challenge Corporation) to large bilateral and multilateral donors (e.g., the World Bank and the United Nations Development Program). We also work with national and local governments, nongovernmental organizations (NGOs), think tanks, foundations and universities. For more information, please visit our website at www.msiworldwide.com.  Project Summary  The Middle East and North Africa Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning Services (MENA MELS) Activity delivers high-quality technical support for monitoring, evaluation, and learning to the Middle East Bureau, its ten field missions, operating units, and implementing partners. Project services include monitoring systems, evaluations, assessments and research; analysis and synthesis; learning and utilization; and MEL capacity building and training. Additional information on the MENA MELS Project is available here . Under MENA MELS, the MSI team will conduct an evaluation of the USAID/Morocco Inclusive Socio-Economic Development Beni Mellal-Khenifra (ISED-BMK) and Marrakech-Safi (ISED-MS) projects. Both activities work to improve sub-national participatory governance and to increase inclusive economic growth opportunities and livelihoods, especially for women, youth, people with disabilities, and rural residents. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the effectiveness of the innovative approach taken by the ISED activities in integrating economic growth and democracy and governance programming as a development catalyst.  Please note: Only Moroccan citizens are eligible for this position**   Position Summary  The Local Researcher will support the Team Lead and other team members in carrying out all necessary tasks to complete the ISED evaluation. The Local Researcher will support the team in data collection planning and conducting data collection in-person. This role will be expected to participate in the team planning workshop, schedule interviews and group discussions with program participants, conduct interviews, take and translate notes during data collection, and support overall planning/logistics when appropriate. The Local Researcher may also contribute to reviewing literature and drafting sections of the evaluation report. The period of performance is on/about January – June 2025.  Responsibilities   Participate in data collection and training of teams going to the field.  Support fieldwork planning including ensuring that data collection instruments are translated and finalized.  Prepare daily itineraries for data collection team including coordinating logistics for the team.  Participate in data collection, including taking extensive notes during primary data collection and/or conducting key informant interviews and focus group discussions.  Review data quality on ongoing basis and work with the Team Lead and Subject Matter Expert (SME) to improve the data collection, coordinating closely with the evaluation team through regular check-ins.  Perform related duties to support the evaluation team during data collection, as required and assigned.   Qualifications   Bachelor’s degree in social sciences, international development, business, or related field required.  Minimum three years of experience in data collection required.  Experience working with USAID is preferred.  Ability to work well as part of a team, with strong interpersonal and communication skills is required.  Ability to communicate technical information clearly and effectively with professionals required.  Ability to travel in various areas of Morocco.  Strong organizational, time management, qualitative and analytical skills required.  Proficiency in using Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Teams or other video/voice calling software required.  Oral and written proficiency in English and Arabic required. Oral and written proficiency in French preferred.   MSI is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We strive to develop and maintain a culture that honors the perspectives and identities of our employees, our communities and those impacted by our work.  We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.  MSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Affirmative Action/Americans with Disabilities/Veterans Employer.  Reasonable Accommodations  MSI is dedicated to hiring an inclusive workforce. If you would like to request reasonable accommodations during the application process, please visit Tetra Tech’s Disability Assistance Page . Our recruitment team looks forward to engaging in an interactive process to provide reasonable accommodations for candidates.  Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.  Project opportunity  Economic Growth (International Development)   Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (International Development)   Additional Information   Organization: 216 MSI

N  Position Type Non-Management  Ayudar en la gestión del inventario de habitaciones para maximizar los ingresos de agrupación de habitaciones, así como mantener la exactitud de la información y mejorar los esfuerzos de automatización en el sistema de reservas. Ayudar en la preparación de análisis competitivos y otros documentos de apoyo, para su presentación en las reuniones de estrategia de ventas del mercado. Ayudar con la administración de las autorizaciones, tarifas y restricciones de habitaciones; incluyendo la comunicación de restricción de tarifas y la estrategia de las propiedades. Realizar todos los informes de fin de mes de gestión de ingresos y auditoría; y proporcionar información prospectiva a los efectos de la previsión, la orientación de las áreas de necesidad, y el equilibrio de las expectativas financieras. Generar, procesar y actualizar con precisión, todos los informes de gestión de ingresos de la propiedad y del mercado; y actuar como fuente principal para la mayoría de las necesidades analíticas, y dar informes del equipo de gestión de ingresos. Ayudar con el mantenimiento del sistema; incluyendo, pero no limitado a, la introducción de obstáculos de tarifa, la supervisión de la demanda prevista, la actualización de la previsión de grupo, y la ejecución de comprobaciones diarias del sistema. Ayudar con la formación de asociados nuevos según sea necesario en herramientas de gestión de ingresos. Asistir con la implementación de estrategias de ventas dentro de los hoteles en los sistemas de reservas e inventarios.  Cumplir con todas las políticas y procedimientos de seguridad de la compañía, asegurarse de que el uniforme y el aspecto personal sean pulcros y profesionales. Mantener la confidencialidad de la información propietaria y proteger los activos de la empresa. Dar la bienvenida y reconocer a todos los huéspedes de acuerdo con las normas de la empresa; anticipar y atender a las necesidades de servicio de los huéspedes; agradecer a los huéspedes con apreciación genuina. Hablar con otros utilizando un lenguaje claro y profesional; contestar los teléfonos usando la etiqueta apropiada. Desarrollar y mantener relaciones de trabajo positivas con otros; escuchar y responder adecuadamente a las preocupaciones de otros empleados. Cumplir con las expectativas y estándares de garantía de calidad. Leer y verificar visualmente la información en una variedad de formatos; mover, levantar, transportar, empujar, tirar y colocar objetos que pesen menos de o igual a 15 libras sin ayuda; pararse, sentarse o caminar durante un período de tiempo prolongado. Ejecutar otras tareas de trabajo razonables solicitadas. Experiencia laboral afín: Al menos 1 año de experiencia laboral afín.  Experiencia como supervisor: No se requiere experiencia como supervisor.  Licencia o certificación: Ninguna  Marriott International es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Creemos en la importancia de contratar a una fuerza laboral diversa, así como apoyar una cultura inclusiva que anteponga a las personas. Nos comprometemos a respetar el principio de no discriminación por cualquier motivo protegido, como la discapacidad y condición de veterano o cualquier otra situación protegida por las leyes aplicables.  Marriott Hotels se esfuerza por mejorar el arte de la hospitalidad, innovando siempre que puede mientras mantiene el confort de lo familiar en todo el mundo. Como anfitrión de Marriott Hotels, nos ayudarás a mantener la promesa de “Una experiencia hotelera maravillosa, siempre” con un servicio cuidado y sincero, que se adelanta a las necesidades de los huéspedes, para así mejorar este legado vivo. Con un nombre que es sinónimo de hospitalidad en todo el mundo, nos enorgullece invitarte a consultar las oportunidades de empleo de Marriott Hotels. Al unirte a Marriott Hotels, te unes a una cartera de marcas con Marriott International. Estarás donde puedes llevar a cabo tu mejor trabajo, comenzarás a cumplir tu propósito, formarás parte de un increíble equipo mundial y te convertirás en tu mejor versión.  JW Marriott forma parte de la cartera de lujo de Marriott International y se compone de más de 100 hermosos hoteles en ciudades destacadas y ubicaciones de resorts privilegiadas en todo el mundo. JW cree que los empleados son lo primero, porque, si tú eres feliz, los huéspedes también lo serán. Los empleados de JW Marriott son confiados, innovadores, genuinos, intuitivos y llevan adelante el legado de la marca y del fundador de la empresa, J. Willard Marriott. Nuestros hoteles ofrecen una experiencia laboral inigualable, donde formarás parte de una comunidad y disfrutarás de verdadera camaradería con un grupo de colegas muy variado. JW crea oportunidades de capacitación, desarrollo, reconocimiento y, lo más importante, un lugar donde puedes seguir tu pasión en un ambiente de lujo enfocado en el bienestar holístico. El trato excepcional a los huéspedes empieza con el modo en que cuidamos a nuestros empleados. Este es el The JW Treatment™. Al unirte a JW Marriott, te unes a una cartera de marcas con Marriott International. Estarás donde puedes llevar a cabo tu mejor trabajo, comenzarás a cumplir tu propósito, formarás parte de un increíble equipo mundial y te convertirás en tu mejor versión.

Our team  A core contributing factor to the influence Instiglio has had thus far includes our collaborative, highly skilled and diverse team. We are a team of 100+ people, representing 15+ nationalities, with offices in Colombia, Kenya, Morocco, Mauritius and the USA. Our team of practitioners has extensive development and government experience, including previous roles in international development banks, management consulting, national governments, multilateral agencies, INGOs and academia.  Eligibility and job allocation  We are recruiting for multiple positions, with successful candidates assigned to one of our teams: Global, Nairobi (Anglophone Africa), or Rabat (Francophone Africa). Candidates must have the required permits to work in Kenya or Morocco, while international applicants are welcome to apply for positions in Mauritius.  Please submit your application for only one role. Our team will evaluate your application, and during the interview, we will explore which team would be the best fit for your qualifications and interests.  How you will make an impact  At Instiglio, you'll gain unique experience working at the intersection of the private, public, and social sectors to improve the effectiveness of development spending. As an Associate or Analyst at Instiglio, you will gain expertise in a range of innovative approaches that support public institutions, funders and other development partners to improve their social and environmental impact across a range of sectors. In terms of sector expertise, Associates and Analysts are generalist positions that provide an opportunity to work across sectors, exploring different topics including but not limited to education, health, climate, migration, workforce development, livelihoods, and water and sanitation.  Associates and Analysts at Instiglio support project teams in guiding internal and external stakeholders through difficult, yet important, changes to their operations by translating complex concepts into understandable insights. You will be focused on Instiglio's global project portfolio, working within teams to support senior leadership and external partners around the world on projects focused on donor transformation, thought leadership, innovation, and Results-Based Financing (RBF) designs. You will play a crucial role in the execution of projects working in teams composed of a Project Lead, Project Manager(s), Senior Associates, and fellow Associates and Analysts. You will also get to develop and hone your people management skills by guiding Analysts and Interns working under you to deliver high-quality services.  Tasks may include:  Participating in the preparation of proposals and client deliverables, such as PowerPoint presentations, publications and Excel analyses. Conducting literature reviews and preparing case studies to guide decision-making.Developing and articulating technical components of RBF and performance management instruments in an accurate and easy-to-understand manner. Describing and interpreting graphs, analyzing data and applying statistical concepts (e.g. mean, SD, regressions) to draw actionable insights/hypotheses. Proposing and structuring data analyses and testing hypotheses. Contributing to the execution of change management plans for stakeholders across sectors, and in the creation of proposals for clients, using clear communication. Supporting internal business development efforts by mapping donors and preparing pitch decks.   Who you are  We are growing a team of resourceful go-getters that are driven by our mission, curious about the world, and dedicated to a life of learning.  Our ideal candidate will need to meet the following requirements:   Experience:At least 1-3 years' relevant experience in strategy/management consulting, international development, public policy or similar fields. Experience in data analysis and management. Experience in quantitative and qualitative research.Experience in performance management and results-based financing are an added advantage. Education: Bachelor's degree in Economics, International Development, Statistics, Public Policy, Political Science, Business, Engineering or related fields. Master's degree in related subjects is a plus.Skills Problem Solving & Analysis: Demonstrate strong strategic and structured thinking combined with analytical skills to dissect complex client challenges and distill insights that lead to actionable recommendations. Project Management & Organizational Skills: Exhibit the ability to manage individual workstreams independently, set clear priorities, and effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. Take initiative in contributing to team growth and supporting team members. Communication & Interpersonal Skills: Communicate insights clearly and confidently, both verbally and in writing, to clients and senior stakeholders. Build rapport and trust through concise, effective communication. Leadership & Initiative: Show a willingness to take ownership of tasks, work independently, and continuously seek out and implement innovative solutions. Display strong motivation to grow within a high-performance environment. Technical & Digital Proficiency: Possess knowledge of data analysis tools and business modeling, along with the ability to interpret data effectively to support recommendations. Adaptability & Resilience: Thrive in a fast-paced consulting environment, effectively balancing multiple priorities under tight deadlines while delivering high-quality results. Language skills:Full written and oral working proficiency in English (C2). Applicants for our Morocco office should also have full written and oral proficiency in French (C2).  How you can grow with us   Joining Instiglio as an Associate or Analyst will enable you to accelerate your career in international development, consulting and public service, playing a critical role in shaping and delivering impactful projects with leading development actors, with the guidance of more experienced senior staff. Instiglio has a strong feedback culture, with all staff receiving bi-annual formal, structured reviews, in addition to real-time feedback. Additionally, a mentorship system and development plans are in place to ensure that staff receive proper support in their professional development.  Working model and benefits  Instiglio has adopted a hybrid working model i.e., a minimum of two (2) days a week at the office for face-to-face connections. We offer generous benefits, which include seven (7) personal days, sixty (60) remote workdays, travel and health insurance, a company holiday between Christmas and New Year's in addition to the legal vacation days, and parental leave, among others.  Interested? Join our team!  Submit your application by attaching an English version of your CV and cover letter. In your cover letter answer the following questions: (1) Why are you a good fit for this role? (2) What is your motivation to apply to Instiglio? Applications will be reviewed on a rolling-basis.  Instiglio is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to giving everyone a fair go.

About RWSRWS Holdings plc is a unique, world-leading provider of technology-enabled language, content and intellectual property services. Through content transformation and multilingual data analysis, our unique combination of technology and cultural expertise helps our clients to grow by ensuring they are understood anywhere, in any language.Our purpose is unlocking global understanding. Description De L'offre D'emploi  Joining Cnexia is choosing to be part of an ambitious project that values Innovation, promotes Continuous Learning and enables all tech champions to fulfill their creative dreams.  At Cnexia, we do more than support the clients of our world-class network and services. We develop innovative solutions and create original multiplatform media content. In fact, we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate on the web, interact with Mobile Apps or benefit from an AI-enhanced experience.  Proud of our status as a fully owned Moroccan subsidiary of the largest Canadian Telecom company, we have been ceaselessly growing our team since 2021. With over 1100 employees, mainly based in Fez, we have expanded in the northern region of the kingdom with our Brand-new state of the art site in Technopolis Rabat.  If you are ready for this challenge, we invite you to join a community that values bold ideas and professional growth all in an engaging multi-cultural world-class environment.  As a Business/Data Analyst, your main responsibilities will be as follows:  Work with multiple teams to collect and document business requirements / User Stories Work within various database environments such as Teradata and SAS to design, develop and deliver data solutions, ensuring accuracy and quality Design, construct, modify, integrate, implement and test data models and database management systemsUtilize advanced SQL to analyze data and perform data mining analysis.Effectively manage data mining analysis and report to various stakeholdersEstablish & maintain effective relationships with cross-functional product teams, colleagues and process teams, including virtual environment (i.e. conference calls, videoconference)   Compétences et expérience requises  Profile Main Requirements (must Have Qualifications)  University or college degree in engineering, computer sciences, physic, mathematics or relevant experience in equivalent domain7 years of experience in business intelligence related functions (testing, analysis, coding, etc.) 2 years of experience working in agileBilingualism is an asset (English / French).Strong data analytical & problem solving skills and demonstrated ability to be highly creative in formulating solutions.Proficiency in programming languages including SAS, Oracle and Teradata SQLStrong knowledge of relational databasesExcellent communication skillsAutonomous and self-motivated with an ability to prioritize   Nice To Have  Working knowledge of SAS ViyaGoogle Cloud experience includeing BIG QueryWorking knowledge of MicroStrategyStrong leadership skills with risk-management Results-orientedUnderstanding of business needs/input, customer focus Ability to adapt and work in a fast paced environment with good tolerance to ambiguity and manage multiple projects

Job Title: Business Research - Senior Research Analyst - Casablanca
Description: About Us  Infomineo is a fast-growing business insights provider, bringing Brainshoring to global clients across a range of services: Business research, Content Services, Graphic Design, and Data Analytics. Our clients include leading Consultancies, Fortune 500 companies, Governments, and NGOs. Infomineo counts 350+ employees spread across 5 offices covering EMEA and the Americas (Casablanca, Cairo, Dubai, Barcelona and Mexico City).  About This Role  Are you intellectually curious? Do you have a knack for solving puzzles? Do you want to make an impact? If yes, then this role is right for you. As a Business Research Analyst at Infomineo, you'll be responsible for supporting clients with their research needs across different regions and industries.  You will be joining one of our teams and working from the office you've applied to. This is a client facing role in which you will work closely with clients to answer their business questions through delivery of outstanding quality research based on credible sources and solid research methodologies. The subjects you will be working on will be rarely the same. You will be challenged in this role, but also supported, by your managers, Professional Development Coach and peers, to grow and acquire the skills you need to reach your professional potential.  What You Will Do  Analyzing the client's request and clarifying it with the client if neededDefining the research strategy (indicating sources to be checked, prioritizing tasks, setting a time budget for each task)Clarifying with the client the format to be used for the deliverables (Excel, Word or PowerPoint)Gathering data from primary (interviews) and secondary (web and databases) sourcesSuggesting alternatives when the required information is not available Analyzing the data and checking for accuracy (Quality assurance)Packaging the deliverables in a structured way and providing backup information Reporting to the Managers (on the status of the request: closed, on-hold; discussing relevancy of methodologies/approaches used to conduct the research) Preparing monthly newsletter for the internal use   Their performance is measured in terms of:  Quality: delivering accurate, verified and reliable informationCreativity and resourcefulness: ability to hunt the information using different tools with a focus on resultsEffectiveness: ability to work in a productive way (prioritizing tasks, staying focused etc.) being 100% reliable and to deliver on time   Who You Are  Background & linguistic skills:  You have 2 years of relevant work experienceYou have the ability to analyze a problem, ask relevant questions, and think outside-of-the-boxYou have past experience in or a love for research, consulting or data analysisYou hold a Bachelors or Masters degree in Business, Economics, or similar fieldYou are at ease when working with figures and concepts that include modeling or correlation analysisYou are a creative self-starter that appreciates working in an entrepreneurial environmentYou enjoy collaborating with people and working in teamsFull proficiency in English, French and Arabic - Additional languages are a plus (German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish)   What We Offer  A competitive salary A great working environment & fast-track career trajectoryA healthy work-life balanceHealth insurance BenefitsSnacks (of course)   Don't hesitate. Apply by clicking on the button. Kindly include a cover letter with your application. We want to learn more about you!  What is it like to work at Infomineo?  If you've spoken with someone who works at Infomineo, you've probably heard that our people are our most valuable asset. Our diversity, both in terms of professional experience and culture, is the company's greatest strength.  By being a part of Infomineo, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside a friendly, smart, and international team of researchers that value intellectual vitality and creativity. You will learn the best practices, tools to use when conducting primary and secondary research. You will grow your career, expertise across different regions and industries. As a member of the team, you'll be encouraged to contribute by applying your ideas while playing an instrumental role in the company's development and growth. Within this role, you'll support leading international institutions & companies with the data and information required to fuel key business decisions.

Contexte du recrutement et définition de poste  Position Overview  We are looking for a Lead Data Analyst. They will be responsible for creating insightful dashboards, documenting data processes, designing reliable DataMart models, benchmarking tools and practices, and setting standards for data modeling and visualization.  Key Responsibilities  Dashboard Creation:Design and maintain intuitive dashboards that provide clear insights into key metrics.Develop and propose visualizations that effectively illustrate the trends and stories behind each KPI.Collaborate with business teams to identify the most relevant indicators.Process Documentation:Ensure the continuity of our data processes by regularly updating or creating comprehensive documentation related to workflows.Regularly update the data catalogue with newly calculated KPIs, ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of all data.Data Modeling: Propose and design models for DataMarts that adhere to internal standards, ensuring robust and reliable data models.Benchmarking and state-of-the-art monitoring: Capacity to benchmark data modeling and data visualization tools and stay up-to-date with the latest practices.Norming: Define, with the data analytics team, the standards and norms for data modeling, visualization and Warehousing.  Profil recherché  Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.Strong knowledge in Data modeling.Strong knowledge in SQL querying.Strong knowledge in Dashboard creation tools Tableau and PowerBI.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to lead a team and work in a group. Bonus:GitLabFLow framework;Python knowledge;Qlik knowledge.

En savoir plus   Le Groupe EXPLEO s’appuie sur 19000 collaborateurs hautement qualifiés qui fournissent des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée dans 30 pays. Expleo vous aide à réaliser vos ambitions et à assurer, ensemble, votre avenir. Nous vous offrons un mélange unique de réflexion audacieuse et d’exécution fiable, pour accélérer l’innovation à travers chaque étape de votre chaîne de valeur.  Au-delà de rejoindre une entreprise, c’est donc une aventure humaine que nous vous proposons de VIVRE !!   Mission   Analyse et extraction de données :Création de requêtes SQL via GCP BigQuery pour extraire des données spécifiques.Analyse approfondie des données et production de résultats à l’aide de Python (Pandas) via Jupyter Notebook.Automatisation des processus :Automatisation des tâches répétitives et collecte des données via Selenium.Création d’interfaces interactives pour importer des fichiers CSV (via Streamlit).Visualisation et reporting :Conception de tableaux de bord dynamiques dans Looker Studio pour visualiser des données préalablement sélectionnées.Vérification croisée des données à l’aide de TCD (Tableaux Croisés Dynamiques) dans Excel.Vérification des VINs dans les campagnes via V-Research et création de formules Excel pour des calculs simples.Support et gestion de projets :Support à l’équipe CVB pour la gestion des incidents et des développements via la création de tickets JIRA.Collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour s’assurer que les solutions développées répondent aux attentes.Documentation et formation :Rédaction de spécifications fonctionnelles et de manuels d’utilisation pour les applications développées."  Qualifications  Maîtrise de SQL, particulièrement sur GCP BigQuery. Expertise en Python (notamment avec Pandas) et utilisation de Jupyter Notebook.Expérience avec des outils d’automatisation tels que Selenium et Streamlit.Compétences avancées en création de tableaux de bord via Looker Studio.Bonne maîtrise d’Excel, y compris les Tableaux Croisés Dynamiques et la rédaction de formules simples.Connaissance des outils de gestion des tickets, tels que JIRA.Capacité à rédiger une documentation claire et structurée.

Contexte du recrutement et définition de poste  Rattaché à la Direction Stratégie et Incubation, vous aurez comme mission d'assurer le le brainstorming et l'analyse des uses cases, vous serez le product owner des produits de la Direction et veillerai à ce que les développements réalisés suivent les besoins de connaissance client.  Responsabilités principales  1- Garantir que les problématiques métiers sont bien traitées   S'assurer que chaque besoin métier a bien été pris en compte et est étudié d'un point de vue technologique et data Assurer le suivi de la réponse à la problématique Assurer un retour régulier aux directions métier  2- Proposer de nouvelles idées aux directions métier   Traduire la donnée disponible et les capacités de développement de produits data en des termes métiers  3- Exprimer les besoins métier dans un jargon technique   Bien comprendre les techniques et méthodes utilisées dans la Direction Savoir évaluer la complexité d'un use case métier  4- Prioriser les besoins au regard de l'intérêt business et de la complexité métier   Avoir un rôle de product owner sur les produits Garder en tête l'intérêt du métier  5- Présentation des résultats de la Direction  Profil recherché  Formation: Bac+5 école d'ingénieur  Expérience requise: 5 ans

| IT & Tech Engineering | Professional | | Allianz Services | Full-Time | Permanent  We are seeking an experienced Data Modeler with expertise in Data Vault Modeling to design, implement, and optimize data models for Allianz Operating Entities. You will play a critical part in desining and optimizing data models. You will be responsible for delivering high-quality data solutions, developing robust data architectures,and ensuring that the data standars aligh with organisational requirements. We want people who are excited to solve the hard problems, eager to work with a larger team of data scientists & engineers and ready to make business impact in areas related to Pricing, Claims, Sales, Marketing, Operations or any other ongoing research into the organisation  What You Do   Providing guidance and examples for Operating Entities on how to deliver data via a new data standard to a data vault model  Interact with Allianz Operating Entities  In depth understanding of primary insurance exposure coverages  Develop data model mapping and create data model conversions (e.g. CSV flat files to data vault ingestion structures)  Participate in the harmonization of Data Quality Frameworks  Provide analyses of delivered data in order to align definitions and reference values  Data quality checks   What You Bring   Strong Experience in Data Vault Modelling (Knowledge in SqlDBM, Azure, Synapse appreciated)  Insurance knowledge (esp. primary insurance coverages focus Natural Catastrophe & Cyber)  Programming experience (esp. SQL)  Several years of work experience in insurance data model design and data interfaces, data quality or similar  Analytical Mindset ,Excellent communication in English.  Familiarity with additional data modeling or analytics tools is a plus.   Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.  We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.  We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.  Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Job Title: North African Arabic Audio Data Contributor
Description: Project Location: RemoteTask duration: approximately 90 minsEngagement Model: One-time task, task-based DataForce by TransPerfect is looking for parents/guardians with children between the ages of 7 to 17 to participate in our Zaatar Speech Collection project for native North African Arabic adults and children. Task Description: The purpose of this project is to improve the functionality of North African Arabic voice recognition technologies used in educational platforms. For this project, we are looking for North African Arabic families with children between 7 to 17 years of age. Each child will need to record a series of sentences in North African Arabic, using our mobile application, DataForce Contribute. The parents/legal guardians will be provided with the project guidelines, the scripts that need to be read, and instructions on how to download and use our app. Eligibility: To participate your children should meet the following qualifying criteria:- Be 7 to 17 years old.- Native North African Arabic Speaker- The parent/legal guardian of the child(ren) needs to register the child(ren), sign the Parental Consent Form, and have a smartphone device to download our app and use it for recording. Note that we are running this project for all North African Arabic accents, kindly check our website for the rest of the accents needed. You can also write to DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com if you want to get the registration link(s) for other Arabic accents. Compensation - Children aged 7 to 12 yearsThere will be 3 sessions to be recorded, each session will take up to 30 minutes and it will be compensated with $15 USD.- Children aged 13 to 17 yearsThere will be 3 sessions to be recorded, each session will take up to 30 minutes and it will be compensated with $15 USD.- Adults :  $27 USD. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com  DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching, and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.  What You Will Do  At Volvo Maroc, you will contribute to the transformation of our company, the transport industry and society at large.  We are seeking a Data Analysis Intern to assist in our data analysis initiatives under the direct guidance of our Managing Director. This internship is designed as an end-of-studies project, lasting six months, where you will gain hands-on experience in a dynamic environment while contributing to meaningful projects.  Key Responsibilities  Collaborate with the managing Director to analyze and interpret data related to our operations.Utilize tools such as Excel and SQL to manage and manipulate large datasets.Assist in developing reports and dashboards to provide insights on key performance indicators.Conduct research to support data-driven decision-making.Present findings and recommendations to the team.  Qualifications  Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analysis, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related field.Proficiency in Power BI, Excel and SQL; experience with other data analysis tools is a plus.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent attention to detail and ability to work independently.Passionate about data analysis and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment.Strong communication skills to present findings clearly.  What We Offer  A paid internshipHands-on experience in data analysis within the trucking industry.Mentorship from the Managing Director and other experienced professionals.Opportunity to contribute to real projects that impact the business.A collaborative and supportive work environment.  Ready for the next move?   Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!  Volvo Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.  Who We Are And What We Believe In  Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.  Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.  At Volvo Trucks you will be part of leading the way towards a sustainable transport industry. For nearly a century we have been innovating for people – to make life easier, better and safer. Driving progress is our promise to customers, to the industry and to society. At Volvo Trucks we share a curiosity to learn, we work with passion and we embrace change to stay ahead. Join us, together we move the world we want to live in.

Eskimoz est une agence d’acquisition digitale (SEO, Paid, Content, Data) qui propose un accompagnement sur mesure à ses clients pour répondre au mieux à leurs enjeux et contraintes. Depuis 2015, l’agence s’est imposée sur le marché français puis européen en devenant progressivement un acteur incontournable du SEO. Eskimoz a évolué et adresse dorénavant tous les leviers d’acquisition en ligne (SEA, Social ads, Content,...). L'agence se démarque par sa capacité à innover dans la data et à lancer des plateformes web répondant aux besoins du marché du marketing digital. Il y règne un vrai esprit entrepreunarial qui fait son ADN. Eskimoz se développe également sur le secteur de la formation avec son "Academy" qui propose différents formats d'enseignement (e-learning, bootcamp ...) pour former les consultants de demain. Déjà présente à Paris, Lyon, Bordeaux, Madrid, Milan, Londres, Düsseldorf et Casablanca, la team Eskimoz compte aujourd’hui 200 collaborateurs, et ambitionne de poursuivre sa conquête de l’Europe en 2024 ! Nous apprécions le travail que nous faisons et les relations que nous y construisons. Tu travailleras également avec l’équipe Lead data et les autres membres de l’équipe pour développer, tester et déployer des solutions de collecte de données efficaces et fiables au quotidien, tes missions seront les suivantes : Utilisation des outils d’analytics et de tracking, travailler sur le suivi de bout en bout des plateformes et des campagnes (payantes, organiques), et configurer des solutions de trackingÊtre garant du support en interne auprès des consultants sur le maintien des rapports et tableaux de bords partagés aux clientsMettre en avant les données collectées dans des outils de datavision (Looker Studio)Être garant de la définition et l’évolution de plans de marquages pour différents clients à travers l’EuropeCollaborer avec l’équipe data pour définir et être garant des bonnes pratiques en matières d’analytics et de data architectureT’assurer que les données collectées sont exactes et validesUtiliser les outils de Google Cloud Platform (GCP) tels que Artifact Registry, Cloud Run et Cloud Scheduler pour déployer et automatiser les flux de travail de collecte de données. Profil recherché1 à 2 ans d’expérience dans des fonctions similairesExcellent niveau sur Google Tag Manager, Looker Studio, GA4…La connaissance en tracking de conversions publicitaires (par exemple, Google, Facebook, LinkedIn) est un plusTrès bonne compréhension des langages Web, Javascript, SQL et Python, et des outils de développement comme PyCharm ou Visual studio code. La connaissance d’autres langage (C++ etc …) est un plus.Expérience avec l’utilisation des services de Google Cloud est un plusLa connaissance d’outils CRM est un plusCapacité à travailler de manière autonome et à s’adapter à un environnement en évolution rapide.Curieux, assidu et rigoureuxAnglais professionnel (à l’oral et à l’écrit) Notre offre Localisation: Casablanca, Maroc (Quartier Racine)Type de contrat: CDIRémunération : Selon profilAvantages : Mutuelle santé privée.Date de démarrage : 01/25 Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?Tu rejoindras une boîte jeune, dynamique où règnent l’entraide, la bienveillance et l’autonomieTu travailleras auprès de consultants experts dans leur domaineTu avanceras dans une agence en très forte croissance avec de belles perspectives d’évolution en interneTu rejoindras un groupe international avec l’opportunité d’aller travailler à l’étranger, dans nos différents bureaux (Londres, Milan, Madrid, Paris, Dusseldorf)

Projects You Will Work On:- Multi Cloud AI Infrastructure Configuration, Automation and Deployment- Full Stack AI DevOps & Development- Generative AI model, Large Language Models and Foundations models to transform input to output.NB: Input can be text, images, audios or videos; Output can also be text, images, audios or videos- Finance Fraud Detection: Develop advanced fraud detection algorithms leveraging financial data analysis.- Recommender System: Contribute to personalized recommendation systems, enhancing user experiences across platforms.- Sentiment Analysis: Explore sentiment analysis to extract insights from textual data, shaping user sentiment understanding.- Chatbots: Engage in intelligent chatbot development, revolutionizing customer interactions and support.- Image/Audio Video Classification: Push boundaries with multimedia technology by working on image and audio video classification projects.- Text Analysis: Uncover hidden patterns in textual data through sophisticated text analysis techniques. Developable Valuable Skills:Artificial IntelligenceGenerative AIPrompt EngineeringPython Data ScienceStatistical ModellingApplication to Industry ProjectsDeep Learning Methods & TechniquesModel Optimization & Problem-Solving TechniquesEDA and Data VisualizationMachine Learning and Predictive Modelling Learn More: https://refontelearning.com/ Note:This position is part of our unpaid AI & Data Science Study and Internship Program. Upon application, our team will contact you to proceed with the application details and joining process. Thank you for considering Refonte Infini Private Limited for your professional development in the field of data science. We look forward to welcoming you to our dynamic team.

About RWSRWS Holdings plc is a unique, world-leading provider of technology-enabled language, content and intellectual property services. Through content transformation and multilingual data analysis, our unique combination of technology and cultural expertise helps our clients to grow by ensuring they are understood anywhere, in any language.Our purpose is unlocking global understanding. Contexte du recrutement et définition de poste  Rattaché à la Direction Stratégie et Incubation, le Datascientist a pour mission d'analyser et de valoriser la donnée entrante, tout en gardant un œil métier/technique sur le fonctionnement et l'architecture du Datalab.  Résponsabilités Permanentes  1- Garantir une qualité de code exemplaire:   Respecter les règles de code, les conventions stylistiques ainsi que les consignes données Etre critique par rapport aux règles et force de proposition à ce niveau  2- Garantir une automatisation poussée des traitements développés:   Préparer l'intégration des développements dans les workflows existants Réaliser une automatisation avec configuration possible  3- Assurer un niveau confortable de documentation couvrant les aspects techniques et fonctionnels:   Documenter largement toutes les parties critiques du code Documenter les workflows globaux Documenter la signification et l'utilisation de donnée  4- Tester régulièrement la qualité des données:   Effectuer une évaluation préliminaire des données avant leur utilisation Représenter la fiabilité par des dashboards récapitulatifs Se renseigner sur la cause des non fiabilités et les communiquer  5- Garantir une cohérence statistique des analyses effectuées   Valider régulièrement le workflow d'exécution Vérifier régulièrement l'application de la méthodologie Confronter les résultats obtenus avec les métiers concernés  6- Produire des visualisations de données illustrant les analyses effectuées   Réaliser des dashboards de data visualisation en concert avec les métiers  7- Effectuer une veille technologique et méthodologique régulière sur les sujets de la data science  Consacrer une demi-journée par semaine au parcours de sujets d'actualité et de nouvelles techniques en fonction des contraintes opérationnelles courantes  8- Animer des brainstorming autour de uses cases   Tenir des réunions avec les métiers Présenter des cas d'utilisation aux métiers  Profil recherché  Formation: Bac+5 Ecole d'ingénieur  Spécialité: Statistiques / Informatique  Expérience requise: 3 ans minimum

Yassir is the leading super App in the Maghreb region set to changing the way daily services are provided. It currently operates in 45 cities across Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia with recent expansions into France, Canada and Sub-Saharan Africa. It is backed (:$200M in funding) by VCs from Silicon Valley, Europe and other parts of the world.  We offer on-demand services such as ride-hailing and last-mile delivery. Building on this infrastructure, we are now introducing financial services to help our users pay, save and borrow digitally.  Helping usher the continent into a digital economy era. We’re not just about serving people - we’re about creating a marketplace to bring people what they need while infusing social values.  About The Role  As a product data analyst at Yassir, working in the Data and AI team, you will have the opportunity to do life-changing work for Yassir’s millions of customers. You will apply groundbreaking analytics that will shape the super-app strategy of Yassir and support the growth and success of all the services Yassir is currently offering across 45 cities in 7 countries.  Responsibilities  You will work on different products, including ML/AI products, front-end products and backend systems, and will apply your data analysis skills, your analytical thinking and product intuition to create a marketplace of on-demand servicesYou will work cross-functionally with partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Marketing, etc. to identify and solve the most important business and product problems for YassirYou are a data ambassador and foster a data-driven product development cultureProduct: You will influence product strategy and execution. You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to all parties in our marketplace. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, track progress and understand their product’s ecosystemAnalytics: You will work with Engineering on collecting the right data to enable data driven decisions at Yassir. You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses for where product opportunities are and will develop and use a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them, building a continuous test-and-learn environmentCommunication and influence: You will tell data-driven stories. You will influence your partners using insights and recommendations and move your organization to being truly and solely data-driven   Requirements  Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. A minimum experience of 5 years in analytics in a business or product environment Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)   Benefits  Great compensation and bonuses including stock options.Blue sky opportunity with the team; shape the strategic direction of the companySharp, motivated co-workers in a fun hybrid environmentPaid company holidays   WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN YASSIR  Join one of the fastest-growing tech companies in AfricaHave a lasting impact on our company's cultureMake a real impact on the world by helping us bring affordable financial and on-demand services to millions of AfricansWork on some really hard technical challenges from identity infrastructure for Africans, digital payment networks to complex mapping and routing systems across the continentWe are the first Algerian startup to go through Y Combinator program and we’re backed by top investors including Unpopular Ventures, Rebel Fund and DainTree.VC   At Yassir, we believe in the power of diversity and the importance of an inclusive culture. So, if you're ready to bring your unique perspective and experiences to the table, then we're excited to listen.  Don't just apply for a job, come and be a part of our journey. Let's create a better tomorrow together.  We look forward to receiving your application!  Best of luck,  Your Yassir TA Team

Job Title: North African Arabic Audio Data Contributor
Description: Project Location: RemoteTask duration: approximately 90 minsEngagement Model: One-time task, task-based DataForce by TransPerfect is looking for parents/guardians with children between the ages of 7 to 17 to participate in our Zaatar Speech Collection project for native North African Arabic adults and children. Task Description: The purpose of this project is to improve the functionality of North African Arabic voice recognition technologies used in educational platforms. For this project, we are looking for North African Arabic families with children between 7 to 17 years of age. Each child will need to record a series of sentences in North African Arabic, using our mobile application, DataForce Contribute. The parents/legal guardians will be provided with the project guidelines, the scripts that need to be read, and instructions on how to download and use our app. Eligibility: To participate your children should meet the following qualifying criteria:- Be 7 to 17 years old.- Native North African Arabic Speaker- The parent/legal guardian of the child(ren) needs to register the child(ren), sign the Parental Consent Form, and have a smartphone device to download our app and use it for recording. Note that we are running this project for all North African Arabic accents, kindly check our website for the rest of the accents needed. You can also write to DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com if you want to get the registration link(s) for other Arabic accents. Compensation - Children aged 7 to 12 yearsThere will be 3 sessions to be recorded, each session will take up to 30 minutes and it will be compensated with $15 USD.- Children aged 13 to 17 yearsThere will be 3 sessions to be recorded, each session will take up to 30 minutes and it will be compensated with $15 USD.- Adults :  $27 USD. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com  DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching, and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

We are looking for Data Scientists for our client, a leading multinational IT services company.As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in solving diverse business challenges using advanced data analytics and machine learning techniques. You will work collaboratively to turn data into actionable insights, ensuring business impact across various industries and domains. Responsibilities:Data Exploration and Analysis:Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and insights.Clean, preprocess, and transform structured and unstructured data from various sources.Model Development:Build and implement machine learning models for predictive, prescriptive, and descriptive analytics.Optimize models for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.Adapt models and approaches to meet the needs of different industries and projects.Collaboration with Stakeholders:Work closely with business teams to understand problems and define data-driven solutions.Collaborate with Data Engineers, Analysts, and IT teams to ensure seamless data pipelines and deployment.Data Visualization and Communication:Present complex findings and models in a clear, accessible way using visualizations and storytelling.Create dashboards and reports to track model performance and business impact. Requirements:Minimum 3 years working in machine learning and analytics, preferably in a multinational environment.Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.Proficient in Python, R, or Julia for machine learning development.Strong expertise in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.Hands-on experience with big data tools like Apache Spark.Familiarity with cloud ML platforms (SageMaker, Azure ML, Google AI Platform).Knowledge of advanced techniques, including natural language processing (NLP), deep learning, and computer vision.Strong statistical and analytical capabilities.Experience with model deployment and monitoring.Ability to communicate data insights effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders.Nice-to-Have:Experience with MLOps tools and workflows for model deployment and monitoring.Understanding of business processes and domain-specific challenges.

About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.   Our Purpose –  Bridging the World Through Travel   We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.  We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.   Get to Know our  Team:   The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.   In this Role, you’ll get  to:   Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful testsDisplay: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and othersModeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers   What you’ll Need to  Succeed:   Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)Ability to communicate fluently in EnglishExposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, TableauGood numerical reasoning skillsProficiency in ExcelIntellectual curiosity and analytical skills   It’s Great if you  Have:   Experience in digital
